intro: Ixora colei, commonly known as the golden flame ixora, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Ixora colei thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a hedge plant.
